ground_truth_original: American Express addresses the challenges posed by differential surcharging, where merchants either apply higher surcharges to American Express cards compared to Visa and Mastercard or do not surcharge Visa and Mastercard at all, by prohibiting discrimination through provisions in their merchant contracts, including non-discrimination and honor-all-cards clauses, subject to local legal requirements. This approach protects the American Express brand and meets Card Members’ expectations to use their cards freely. Regarding redemption costs and customer rewards programs, American Express invests in customer value through its Membership Rewards program and other Card Member benefits. However, significant changes or failures in reasonably estimating actual redemptions and associated costs could adversely affect profitability. The company relies on third parties for certain redemption options and benefits, and any modifications or discontinuations of these offerings could diminish the program’s value for Card Members. Additionally, new partnerships or changes in service offerings may carry higher costs, fail to resonate with customers, negatively impact merchant discount rates, or dilute the brand, all of which pose risks to American Express’s profitability and brand value.
